item.title: Decentralized Optimization with Coupled Constraints
item.description: In this paper, we propose the first first-order algorithm with accelerated linear convergence for decentralized optimization with coupled constraints

item.title: Sample Size Determination: Posterior Distributions Proximity
item.description: Two approaches to determining a sufficient sample size based on the proximity of posterior distributions of model parameters on similar subsets

item.title: Determining a sufficient sample size based on the a posteriori distribution of model parameters
Forecasting fMRI Images From Video Sequences: Linear Model Analysis
item.description: Using linear models and testing hypotheses about the relationship between data

item.title: Models of epidemic spread, in particular COVID-19 as a model of stochastic chemical kinetics
item.description: Various approaches to modeling the spread of epidemics, differential equations and Markov processes

item.title: Optimization methods for quadratic problems with large dimensionality
item.description: Comparison of different methods of solving high-dimensional linear regression problems

item.title: Intelligent Presentation Generator
item.description: Application for generating presentations based on text files using topic modeling

item.title: About
item.description: Hi there ðŸ‘‹ I am Nikita Kiselev Fourth year Bachelor student in Applied Mathematics and Physics at Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology working under the supervision of PhD Andrey Grabovoy Currently finishing my Bachelor’s thesis Interested in Machine Learning and Optimization Education Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology BSc in Applied Mathematics and Physics Sep 2020 – Present Thesis: Bayesian Sample Size Estimation Advisor: Andrey Grabovoy GPA: 4.88/5 (8.91/10)
